meanings.definition: Instruct or urge (someone) to do something.
meanings.sent1: The teacher enjoins the students to study hard for the upcoming exam.
meanings.sent2: She enjoins her children to always be kind to others.
meanings.sent3: The coach enjoins the team to give their best effort in every game.
meanings.sent4: The wise elder enjoins the young ones to cherish their time with loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The leader enjoins the community to come together and support each other during tough times.

meanings.definition: Prohibit or forbid (someone) from doing something.
meanings.sent1: The sign enjoins visitors from entering the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The law enjoins citizens from driving above the speed limit.
meanings.sent3: The doctor enjoins the patient from consuming sugary drinks for health reasons.
meanings.sent4: The contract enjoins the company from disclosing confidential information.
meanings.sent5: The rule enjoins students from using their phones during class hours.
